title: The OASIS OpenC2 1.0 Language Spec Command Schema

action.title: OpenC2 Action
action.$comment: Could use oneOf with const instead of enum to have titles on each item, but enum here is more concise

actuator.title: OpenC2 Actuator
actuator.$comment: We disallow an empty actuator specified here using minProperties setting, though spec is unclear about that; Also, spec wants only a single actuator key included, but we allow many (which is needed)

slpf.title: Actuator Specifiers defined in the Stateless Packet Filter profile

^x-[A-Za-z0-9_]*$.$comment: Non-OASIS extensions must start with x-

start_time.title: The specific date/time to initiate the Action (milliseconds since the epoch)

stop_time.title: The specific date/time to terminate the Action (milliseconds since the epoch)

duration.title: The length of time for an Action to be in effect (milliseconds)

response_requested.title: The type of Response required for the Action
response_requested.$comment: Could use oneOf with const instead of enum to have titles on each item (see example)

slpf.title: Command Arguments defined in the Stateless Packet Filter profile

^x-[A-Za-z0-9_]*$.$comment: Non-OASIS extensions must start with x-

mime_type.$comment: Why is this called mime_type when it is referencing a media-type RFC?
mime_type.title: Permitted values specified in the IANA Media Types registry, RFC 6838

binary.title: OpenC2 Binary
binary.$comment: Possible that only base64 is supported and not base64url (which spec specifies here)

command_id.title: OpenC2 Command Identifier
command_id.$comment: Could add minimum and maximum length validators here, or a format regex to check for uuid

device.title: OpenC2 Device
device.$comment: Upgraded to require either a hostname or a device_id (or both), which is more useful

hostname.title: A hostname that can be used to connect to this device over a network

idn_hostname.title: An internationalized hostname that can be used to connect to this device over a network

device_id.title: An identifier that refers to this device within an inventory or management system

idn_hostname.title: Internationalized Internet host name as specified in [RFC5890], Section 2.3.2.3.

features.title: An array of zero to ten names used to query an Actuator for its supported capabilities.
features.$comment: Upgraded to not allow repeating enums in the array (unique items only). Could use oneOf with const instead of enum to have titles on each item (see example)

file.title: OpenC2 File
file.$comment: Upgraded to require any one of these (or more), which is more useful

name.title: The name of the file as defined in the file system

path.title: The absolute path to the location of the file in the file system

hashes.title: One or more cryptographic hash codes of the file contents
OpenC2 Hashes
hashes.$comment: Upgrade to require at least one of (the spec allows it to be empty, but that is not useful)

md5.title: MD5 hash as defined in RFC 1321

sha1.title: SHA1 hash as defined in RFC 6234

sha256.title: SHA256 hash as defined in RFC 6234

hostname.title: A legal Internet host name as specified in RFC 1123

ipv4_net.title: An IPv4 address range including CIDR prefix length.
ipv4_net.$comment: JSON Schema appears not to have built-in support for matching IPv4 addr with CIDR, so using custom regex here

ipv6_net.title: An IPv6 address range including prefix length.
ipv6_net.$comment: JSON Schema appears not to have built-in support for matching IPv6 addr with prefix length, so using custom regex here

ipv4_connection.title: OpenC2 IPv4 Connection
ipv4_connection.$comment: Should require one or both of src_addr or dst_addr; TODO - Add if statement for that.

protocol.title: layer 4 protocol (e.g., TCP) - see l4_protocol section

ipv6_connection.title: OpenC2 IPv6 Connection
ipv6_connection.$comment: Should require one or both of src_addr or dst_addr; TODO - Add if statement for that.

protocol.title: layer 4 protocol (e.g., TCP) - see l4_protocol section

iri.title: OpenC2 IRI - An internationalized resource identifier (IRI).
iri.$comment: Should this include relative-reference URI's as well, using uri-reference format?

l4_protocol.title: Value of the protocol (IPv4) or next header (IPv6) field in an IP packet. Any IANA value, RFC 5237
l4_protocol.$comment: Could use oneOf with const instead of enum to have titles on each item (see example)

mac_addr.title: OpenC2 MAC Address
mac_addr.$comment: Upgraded this to a string in standard MAC Address Format

bin.title: Specifies the data contained in the artifact

url.title: MUST be a valid URL that resolves to the un-encoded content

process.title: OpenC2 Process
process.$comment: Upgraded to require at least one property specified

cwd.title: Current working directory of the process

executable.title: Executable that was executed to start the process

command_line.title: The full command line invocation used to start this process, including all arguments

properties.title: OpenC2 Properties
properties.$comment: Upgraded to not allow repeating items in the array (unique items only)

slpf_actuator.title: The Actuator Specifiers defined for the slpf profile.

hostname.title: RFC 1123 hostname (can be a domain name or IP address) for a particular device with SLPF functionality

named_group.title: User defined collection of devices with SLPF functionality

asset_id.title: Unique identifier for a particular SLPF

asset_tuple.title: Unique tuple identifier for a particular SLPF consisting of a list of up to 10 strings

slpf_args.title: The Command Arguments defined for the slpf profile.

drop_process.title: Specifies how to handle denied packets

persistent.title: Normal operations assume any changes to a device are to be implemented persistently. Setting the persistent modifier to FALSE results in a change that is not persistent in the event of a reboot or restart

direction.title: Specifies whether to apply rules to incoming or outgoing traffic. If omitted, rules are applied to both.

insert_rule.title: Specifies the identifier of the rule within a list, typically used in a top-down rule list.

slpf_direction.title: The Command Arguments defined for the slpf profile.

artifact.title: An array of bytes representing a file-like object or a link to that object.

command_id.title: A reference to a previously issued Command.

device.title: The properties of a hardware device.

features.title: A set of items used with the query Action to determine an Actuator's capabilities.

ipv4_connection.title: A 5-tuple of source and destination IPv4 address ranges, source and destination ports, and protocol

ipv6_connection.title: A 5-tuple of source and destination IPv6 address ranges, source and destination ports, and protocol

ipv4_net.title: An IPv4 address range including CIDR prefix length.

ipv6_net.title: An IPv6 address range including prefix length.

mac_addr.title: A Media Access Control (MAC) address - EUI-48 or EUI-64

process.title: Common properties of an instance of a computer program as executed on an operating system.

properties.title: Data attribute associated with an Actuator

slpf:rule_number.title: Immutable identifier assigned when a rule is created, Identifies a rule to be deleted.

^x-[A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9_]*:[A-Za-z0-9][.$comment: Non-OASIS target extensions must start with x- and be separated by a colon
